member.name: T:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum
member.summary: Contains flags to indicate whether field highlighting and values, and messages from the server, should be displayed or ignored.

member.name: F:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum.Normal
member.summary: Field highlighting and values, and messages from the server, will all be displayed

member.name: F:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum.CancelHighlightFields
member.summary: Any field highlighting sent by the Tropos server will be ignored.

member.name: F:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum.CancelUpdateFields
member.summary: Field values sent by the Tropos server will be ignored and screen fields will be left unchanged.

member.name: F:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum.CancelClearFields
member.summary: Each field value sent by the Tropos server will be updated to the corresponding screen field unless the new value is blank, in which case the screen field will be left unchanged.

member.name: F:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum.CancelMessages
member.summary: Messages sent by the Tropos server will be ignored

member.name: F:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposActionButton.PostExecutionEventArgs.StatusEnum.CancelAll
member.summary: Field highlighting and values, and messages from the server, will all be ignored

member.summary: Number of characters to display (giving a horizontal scrolling window

member.name: P:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposInput.SuppressAbsolute
member.summary: The lookup or calculator button has a style of absolute positioning to align it exactly with the end of the input box. This can cause problems if the TroposInput control inside a scrolling container (e.g. a TroposGridView or GridView). This will normally be corrected automatically, but if the position of the button is still incorrect, then set the SuppressAbsolute property to true to prevent this behaviour and restore relative positioning.

member.name: P:Tropos.Web.UI.TroposDAVL.SuppressAbsolute
member.summary: The DAVL button has a style of absolute positioning to align it exactly with the end of the input box. This can cause problems if the TroposInput control inside a scrolling container (e.g. a TroposGridView or GridView). member.summary: Type of the DAVL: No - no DAVLs, no button; Yes - list based on dataname codes/descriptions; YorN - Yes or No; YorM - Yes/No/Maintain; Dynamic - determined by Tropos application; UOM - list of Units of Measure; SQL - list determined by the SQLStatement property; UserDefined - list provided in the UserDefined property collection

member.name: T:Tropos.Web.UI.DAVLUserDefinedCollection
member.summary: DAVLUserDefinedList behaves like a List>DAVLUserDefinedData< except that it persists itself in the web application's session so that it is not lost when a page is reloaded. The stored data is keyed using the id passed into the constructor.
